title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 221.10 - Packaging variations to be allowed
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 221.10 - Packaging variations to be allowed

State Regulations
(a) For food and food products (other than
meats, meat food products and poultry), the declaration of net quantity of
contents shall express an accurate statement of the quantity of contents of the
package. Reasonable variations caused by loss or gain of moisture during the
course of good distribution practice or by unavoidable deviations in good
manufacturing practice will be recognized. Variations from stated quantity of
contents shall not be unreasonably large. (b) For meats, meat food products and
poultry, the statement of net quantity of contents, as it is shown on a label, shall not be false or misleading and shall express an accurate statement of the
quantity of contents of the container exclusive of wrappers and packaging
substances. Reasonable variations caused by loss or gain of moisture during the
course of good distribution practices or by unavoidable deviations in good
manufacturing practice will be recognized. Variations from stated quantity of
contents shall not be unreasonably large. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 1
ยง
221.10

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
